data.title: Rated Period Dramas
data.meta_description: A celebration of movies and TV series in the period-drama genre, based around a continuous historical timeline showing when the various stories are set.
data.text:
Top-Rated Period Dramas

Here are the top 25 period-drama movies or TV series as rated by visitors to PeriodDramas.com. This list is “live”, meaning that it is based on the ratings as of this moment.

1. North & South (2004 TV Mini-series)

User rating:

4.86 / 5 (from 720 ratings)

Date set: 1851

Directed by: Brian Percival

Writer(s): Elizabeth Gaskell (novel), Sandy Welch

Cast: Daniela Denby-Ashe, Richard Armitage, Tim Pigott-Smith, Sinéad Cusack, Brendan Coyle

2. Pride and Prejudice (1995 TV Mini-series)

User rating:

How to rate

To rate a period drama, find its details page (using the search box or by looking on the timeline), and then look for "Your rating" in the list of details. Choose a rating for it from the drop-down box, and then click on the "Rate!" button.

About the rating system

The period dramas listed above are ranked by their effective rating, which works as follows. Visitors to PeriodDramas.com can give a rating to any of the period dramas in our database. From the given ratings and the number of ratings, the average rating for a period drama can be calculated. The effective rating of each period drama is then calculated using its average rating and the number of ratings it has been given: when a period drama has received a lot of ratings, its average rating is considered to be quite accurate (or “trustworthy”), and its calculated effective rating will then be very close to its average rating; conversely, if a period drama hasn't received many ratings yet, its average rating will not be particularly accurate, and its calculated effective rating will then be closer to a “default” (or “neutral”) rating. The actual calculation we use to determine an effective rating for a period drama is known as the Bayesian average.
